sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The XFree86 package contains the X Windows system for Linux (and other operating systems). It includes the X server, fonts, xterm, a simple winow manager (twm), various utilities, video output drivers, and various input drivers including the mouse and keyboard.
XFree86 also contains libraries and header files for development of X Windows programs.

note.para: The following list of programs is not comprehensive. The full list is in /usr/X11R6/bin. For additional information about these programs, see the respective man page.

sect3.title: XFree86
sect3.para: XFree86 is the X11R6 implementation of the X Windows server.

sect3.title: xf86config
sect3.para: An interactive program for generating an XF86Config file for use with XFree86 X servers.

sect3.title: xf86cfg
sect3.para: A tool to configure XFree86 that can be used to either write the initial configuration file or make customizations to the current configuration.

sect3.title: startx
sect3.para: A script to initialize the X session. It runs xinit.

sect3.title: xinit
sect3.para: This program is used to start the X Window System server.

sect3.title: twm
sect3.para: A Tab Window Manager for the X Window System.

sect3.title: xwininfo
sect3.para: A window information utility for X.

sect3.title: x11perf
sect3.para: An X11 server performance test program.

sect3.title: xlsfonts
sect3.para: A program to list fonts available to the X server.

sect3.title: xvidtune
sect3.para: A video mode tuner for XFree86.

sect3.title: xload
sect3.para: A system load average display for X.

sect3.title: xmodmap
sect3.para: A utility for modifying keymaps and pointer button mappings in X.
